question: What languages can you speak?
transcript: Actually, I am a bilingual. So firstly, my mother tongue is Vietnamese. And the second one is English. And I suppose that on the ground that English is an international language. So almost all the young people could communicate in English. And I am no exception.

anti_overrating.reason: 'I am a bilingual' (I am bilingual). 'on the ground that... So almost all' (because... almost all - the 'So' breaks the structure).

question: First of all, what are the most popular jobs for young people in your country?
transcript: In Vietnam, in my country, now many young people are employed in marketing and communication. this, this industry, would provide the employee to work in a very young, dynamic environment. And also in the context that, the internet is developing and the number of brands is increasing. So marketing and communication play a very crucial role in the digital world What the difference between high income and low income jobs in your country actually in my country high paid job could require the employee to have a comprehensive education and also the formal qualification And people doing the job usually be considered as like white collar worker And, they also, like, graduate from top-tier university. As for lower-income jobs would require the physical strength and physical skills instead of advanced academic level.

anti_overrating.reason: 'provide the employee to work' (allow... to work / provide... with the opportunity to work). 'usually be considered' (are usually considered). 'As for... would require' (As for..., they would require).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common and idiomatic vocabulary skilfully.

question: When is the right time for young people to start making serious plans for their future careers?
transcript: Actually, when a student gets into the high school, they should start a career planning as possible. Like early awareness and orientation would provide them more time to self-explore their strengths, their weaknesses, their references, and also their dreams. And parents and teachers also play a crucial role in helping them to have a clear career path.

anti_overrating.reason: 'gets into the high school' (high school). 'start a career planning as possible' (start career planning as early as possible? / as soon as possible?). 'references' (preferences?).

question: So do you like your job?
transcript: At first I did not enjoy it as much because, I was a fish out of water in this field. And I bore the thought of, being not being cut out for it. So, but like, times went by, I got more chance to work with more people, engage in more projects, and so it started to grow on me eventually.

question: So what is your favorite color?
transcript: If I had to choose, I would say blue, navy blue to be specific. You know like the striped collar on the sailor uniforms You know for me it reminds me of the sky and I really love staring at the vast blue sky and it just gives me hope What the color you dislike and why Okay personally I do not enjoy the color purple because like this hatred may stem from the villains in cartoons or movies back in the day as they were portrayed with a purple like outfit or background So ever since then purple is the definition of something that is evil and sinister for me What colors do your friends like most? So, I am a plain person, but my friends are all like fashion conscious. So, they really know how to dress up whenever they go out. So mismatching the outfits are a must for them to be in style. And in order to do that, they have to combine the two colors, black and white, because they really go well with pretty much anything. So I think that they, those are the colors that they like.

anti_overrating.reason: 'mismatching the outfits are a must' (is a must). 'mismatching' (mixing and matching? mismatching usually implies negative/clashing, but context implies style - mixing/matching).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common and idiomatic vocabulary skilfully.

question: Do you like buying shoes?
transcript: I have to admit that I am a shopaholic, but I, whenever I got a paycheck, but shoes are not my go-to items, you know, because, they are still So many like, designs, products, and, types, to choose from. And those decisions make me having a headache. So I would only like to purchase a pair or two whenever my current ones are worn down, worn out. So it is about like, once every two years.
